Students in grades K-6 will pick up their personal belongings and drop off school materials May 19th and May 20th from 9:00-12:00. In order to maintain social distancing guidelines set by the State of North Dakota, only students will be allowed in the building.
Bowman students will be allowed in the building two students per classroom at a time. K-3 students will use the Roosevelt playground door (Door B) and 4-6 students will use the Middle School Office. Rhame students will use the main doors at each building with no more than 15 students being admitted at one time. Staff members will monitor entries and hallways to ensure social distancing guidelines, remaining six feet apart at all time. Classrooms and the buildings will be cleaned throughout the pick-up/drop off. Students are encouraged to bring a backpack for belongings. If your family has underlying health conditions that may prevent school entry by your child, please contact your classroom teacher for arrangements.

-Mr. Strand

Dear Parents and Students:
The 2019-2020 Bowman County yearbook is now on sale. The yearbook covers kindergarten through seniors, and it includes junior high and high school extra-curricular activities and elementary student council.

If you would like a yearbook, please send this form and payment to
Bowman County School
Attn: Yearbook
102 8th Avenue SW
Drawer H
Bowman, ND 58623

by Wednesday, May 20th. Yearbooks will arrive at the beginning of the 2020 school year.
You may also purchase a yearbook online at https://commpe.pictavo.com/ through May 30, 2020. The link is active on our school website.
Sincerely,
Lyndsey Erickson and Jason Waskiewicz
Yearbook Advisers

Bowman County Ag students had the honor and privilege of hearing Dr. Temple Grandin speak in Beach today and meet her!

Temple Grandin is a professor of Animal Science at Colorado State University and was diagnosed with autism as a toddler. She mentors and speaks on autism and animal science. She has been a major influence in today’s handling facilities for livestock. She was inducted into the National Women’s Hall of Fame and named one of Time magazines “100 most Influential People.”
